intro: Paepalanthus planifolius var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf palm tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is a small, slow-growing palm that typically reaches a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features a slender, unbranched trunk and pinnately compound leaves with long, narrow leaflets. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, round fruits. This variety is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
